metadata.title: USN-2805-1 -- Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerability
metadata.description: Ben Serebrin discovered that the KVM hypervisor implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly catch Alignment Check exceptions. An attacker in a guest virtual machine could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) in the host OS.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-2805-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-3.16.0-53-powerpc64-emb - 3.16.0-53.72~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-53-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-53.72~14.04.1 linux-image-extra-3.16.0-53-generic - 3.16.0-53.72~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-53-powerpc64-smp - 3.16.0-53.72~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-53-generic - 3.16.0-53.72~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-53-powerpc-smp - 3.16.0-53.72~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-53-powerpc-e500mc - 3.16.0-53.72~14.04.1 linux-image-3.16.0-53-lowlatency - 3.16.0-53.72~14.04.1 No subscription required
